segments.text: so , tell me about your new house . How is it different to your old one ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , first of all , it ’ s much bigger . It has the same number of rooms , but each room is larger . We also have a larger garden , which our dog loves , of course !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: so , it ’ s a three-bedrooms detached house ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes . One bedroom is for my wife and i . there ’ s another for our daughter . My wife wants to use the third one as a guest room , but I ’ d like to make it into a study . Our daughter is also keen on
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: what ’ s the kitchen like ? I know both you and your wife like to cook .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that ’ s one of the main reason we chose that particular house . The kitchen and dining room are together . It ’ s really large .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: are the rooms nice and bright ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes , they are . That ’ s very important to us . We like to live in a home with plenty of natural light . Each room has large windows .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: no , we don ’ t . we wish we had one . That ’ s the only thing we wanted , but don ’ t have . The area is very nice and the neighbours seem friendly .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you ’ re right on the edge of the city , aren ’ t you ? There can ’ t be much noise or traffic there . Is it easy to get into city centre ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it ’ s a very quiet neighbourhood . There ’ s some traffic , but not much . It ’ s not very difficult to get to the city centre , but you must remember to turn left and right at the right places or yo
segments.speaker: S2
